stories.text:
A bunch of contributors and myself have created RepliByte - an open-source tool to seed a development database from a production database.

Features:

- Support data backup and restore for PostgreSQL, MySQL and MongoDB

- Replace sensitive data with fake data

- Works on large database (> 10GB) (read Design)

- Database Subsetting: Scale down a production database to a more reasonable size - Start a local database with the prod data in a single command - On-the-fly data (de)compression (Zlib) - On-the-fly data de/encryption (AES-256) - Fully stateless (no server, no daemon) and lightweight binary - Use custom transformers

Available for MacOSX, Linux and Windows.

Repo: https://github.com/Qovery/replibyte
stories.title: Show HN: A tool to seed your dev database with real data

stories.text:
Hey HN! While working at my previous company, I wrote this blog post that sums up some of the topics that were most appreciated by my mentees.

It's about structuring code in a way that helps you keep it sane in the long run. At the time I applied it with Go, but parts of it can be applied to many other imperative programming languages.

https://www.algolia.com/developers-tech-blog/code-and-deep-dives/writing-usable-code
stories.title: Writing Usable Code
